meanings.definition: To eject liquid in a sudden and forceful stream.
meanings.sent1: The water gun was squirting water all over the yard.
meanings.sent2: The lemon squirted juice when I squeezed it.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy kept squirting water from its mouth at the sprinkler.
meanings.sent4: The pressure was building up in the hose, ready to squirt water out.
meanings.sent5: The fountain in the park was squirting water high into the air.

meanings.sent1: I heard the squirting of the ketchup bottle as my friend put it on his burger.
meanings.sent2: The squirting of the hose made the children squeal with delight.
meanings.sent3: The squirting of the water gun turned into a fun game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The squirting of the lemon juice added a tangy flavor to the salad.
meanings.sent5: The squirting of the whale's blowhole was a majestic sight to behold.
